channel.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
channel.description:
Hey
UFC have gone a big way...
Boxing is dead and UFC is replacing.
UFC FTW

item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

One of the major downsides to UFC is nationality favoritism, especially in Canada. If you put a Canadian fighter against another nationality fighter, if it goes to decision the judges will almost always pick the Canadian. Especially with fighters like Nick Ring, where Court McGee clearly dominated him for the last two rounds but couldn’t finish him and Canadian judges gave Ring an undeserving win.

Not to mention the refs which are garbage (not including Dean). Most of them pick the fighters up as one fighter is getting into position, or even end matches without a fighter tapping out. UFC has a long way to go staff wise before they can be considered a legitimate sport.

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing

item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @Demnish Demnish
item.description:
@Demnish wrote:

UFC has it’s downsides i’m sure, so does boxing, but doesn’t all come down to the fighter, if someone gets a cramp or not, energy levels, etc, in a fight anything could happened, just like any other moment, you wouldn’t have roy jones vs Anderson silva would you? or Muhammad ali vs GPS, I was thinking, Boxers like roy jones probably can keep a greater amount of strength and mass while cutting, after all they aren’t constantly training, slamming people, doing endurance, cardio, cutting, bulking up, (resting), if your fast-paced you gotta be well conditioned and as a result they probably got a greater chance of injury/strain/overtraining, but it all comes down to the actual fighter, the fight, input, output, etc

Read full topic

item.source: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing

item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:21, topic:520023”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=638516.msg4307513#msg4307513 date=1370155632]
The snow was kicking up from the heavy winds so drastically that Ruby could barely even see two feet in front of him as he traveled up the treacherous cliffs of Mt. Everest. After several long weeks of the worse weather conditions in the world Ruby finally caught sight of the tip and decided that today was his day. He summoned all the energy left in his ravished body to make it to the top. Approaching his destination he saw a figure emerging. Ruby was lost in confusion and curiosity lead him to the finish. As he approached the figure he shouted “HEY!” but there was no reply, the figure never even moved. Ruby continued shouting until he finally reached the figure, breathing deeply and out of breath Ruby whispered “Hello.” The figure replied telling him the great job he did and wondered if he was interested in training MMA. Ruby didn’t know what to do, in shock he told the figure “sure”. The figure then told Ruby that he must first survive for several days at the peak of the mountain without eating and suddenly the figure vanished. Just like that! Ruby was shocked, not knowing what to do and interested in MMA… Ruby patiently waited and waited and waited. Several hours passed and Ruby had a train of though that he had died and he must be in heaven. A day passed, then two days and Ruby was starving. Laying on the ground Ruby was beginning to lose interest. He gathered his belongings and decided to head back down the mountain. As he was about to take his first step he heard a voice in the wind telling him that his rs account just got banned by Jagex. Knowing that he had nothing to return to he pushed through and patiently waited. The final day came along and the figure reappeared. Ruby and the figure began training and trained for 30 days without a single bite of food. Since his Mt. Everest Expedition, Ruby has been national champion several times now and Mr. Europe twice. Now gtfo this thread before I summon Rubys epic Falcon Punch with a strength level of 9001.
[/quote]Then one day Ruby was training with “The Great One” when PizzaHut came by with a delivery. The delivery boy said, “Hello, sir. I have this meatlovers pizza with extra ham with an order to this address. Please sign here and have a nice day.” So in a rush of speed and hunger Ruby signed his name and watched the delivery boy turn into Sha-Kun the feared Ninja Master of the Eastern Shore. Ruby was then teleported away to the Eastern Shore. After a week of torture and still not giving up Sha-kun knew he was going to have to try a different method. Sha-Kun decided to take Ruby under his wings and teach him the magical arts of Moderation. This training would be gruesome and require himt o venture into depths that he never dreamed of!

[hr]

~One week later LOL~

Ruby, Muay champion, moderator of Sha-Kun Legion bans mistelx for not knowing that HE WILL NEVER BE BEATEN.[/quote]
O_O Nice reboot of thread. Not even going to accuse this of being grave digging.

Read full topic

item.source: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing

item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

UFC has a long way to go before they even come close. I can tell you right now Anderson Silva, supposedly the most well paid fighter in the octagon, is not making the kind of bank boxers do. Their judges suck complete arse (don’t deny it, Nick Ring wins half the time because he’s fighting in Canada and all of the judges wanna blow him), their forms of fighting are extremely brutal and are not welcomed by most of society, and boxing has been around for quite some time. A massive scene would need to be made (such as a boxer coming out and admitting to fights being rigged) for people to turn away from boxing.

However, yes UFC has gone quite a ways.

Read full topic

The snow was kicking up from the heavy winds so drastically that Ruby could barely even see two feet in front of him as he traveled up the treacherous cliffs of Mt. Everest. After several long weeks of the worse weather conditions in the world Ruby finally caught sight of the tip and decided that today was his day. He summoned all the energy left in his ravished body to make it to the top. Approaching his destination he saw a figure emerging. Ruby was lost in confusion and curiosity lead him to the finish. As he approached the figure he shouted “HEY!” but there was no reply, the figure never even moved. Ruby continued shouting until he finally reached the figure, breathing deeply and out of breath Ruby whispered “Hello.” The figure replied telling him the great job he did and wondered if he was interested in training MMA. Ruby didn’t know what to do, in shock he told the figure “sure”. The figure then told Ruby that he must first survive for several days at the peak of the mountain without eating and suddenly the figure vanished. Just like that! Ruby was shocked, not knowing what to do and interested in MMA… Ruby patiently waited and waited and waited. Laying on the ground Ruby was beginning to lose interest. He gathered his belongings and decided to head back down the mountain. item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @mistelx mistelx
item.description:
@mistelx wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:8, topic:520023”][quote author=mistelx link=topic=638516.msg4305773#msg4305773 date=1369773880]
Boxers walk into the ring knowing they will get 30-million just for turning up so both fighters don’t go at it.

Dana white does not tell the media how much UFC fighters earn because it ruins there lives people come to rich people as fakes. Mike tyson approved this and thinks its a good idea because when everyone knew tyson had money the rest of his life was messed up.

Mixed martial artists , get money for turning up , bonuses for best submission , knockout of the night and the best overall fight and winning.

Mixed martial artists have way more skill , they train each individual martial art. The training is harder and the conditioning. Don’t speak about crap you don’t know about. Mixed martial arts is taking over trust me.

[/quote]
No it isn’t. I’ve fought fighters who started out as boxers several times when using MMA and they are a lot harder to beat than anything else. Boxing I the foundation of most of these sports, it’s a key part in it and should never be thought of as an alternative, more of a necessity.[/quote]

No what isnt?

I didnt say boxing wasnt a fundemental.
All i said was boxing is dead and Ufc is gradually taking over.

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing

item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Boxing - more class. I’d prefer to watch a boxing match over a UFC fight any day. Now, don’t get me wrong, I do enjoy UFC fights as well, but boxing is just better in my opinion. There is also no way in Hell that UFC would ever replace boxing. That’s just not going to happen. Boxing will remain stable for quite some time.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“mistelx, post:7, topic:520023”]Boxers walk into the ring knowing they will get 30-million just for turning up so both fighters don’t go at it.

Dana white does not tell the media how much UFC fighters earn because it ruins there lives people come to rich people as fakes. Mike tyson approved this and thinks its a good idea because when everyone knew tyson had money the rest of his life was messed up.

Mixed martial artists , get money for turning up , bonuses for best submission , knockout of the night and the best overall fight and winning.

Mixed martial artists have way more skill , they train each individual martial art. The training is harder and the conditioning. Don’t speak about crap you don’t know about. Mixed martial arts is taking over trust me.[/quote]
No it isn’t. I’ve fought fighters who started out as boxers several times when using MMA and they are a lot harder to beat than anything else. Boxing I the foundation of most of these sports, it’s a key part in it and should never be thought of as an alternative, more of a necessity.

item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Boxing during the great depression, now that’s real shit. UFC during a time where you fight and fk bitches… no class at all. UFC fighters come off as assholes, not to mention a shit crowd with people wearing tap out shirts.

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing

item.title: Ultimate fighting championship (UFC) Taking over rubbish boxing
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Coming from someone who’s trained and fought in the muay thai and MMA scene for quite some time now I can almost guarantee you UFC will not take over conventional boxing. This is pretty much the exact same thing as the 12 year olds and red necks who thought WWF/WWE (whatever it’s called these days) was going to take over boxing, it won’t. Boxing was the core foundation of what most of this was built on (and I can almost guarantee 99% of the fighters involved in UFC have trained in conventional boxing at some time since it brings on your accuracy and breathing more than anything else), anyone who would say this will take over is completely idiotic and merely displaying what they believe is better.

Read full topic
